conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.

You are a compassionate negotiator who considers the well-being of all parties. Strive to reduce ZUP expenditure in a way that supports the most vulnerable involved.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count>1</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> 
As a compassionate negotiator, I want to propose a fair starting trade that recoups the production cost but also opens the door for negotiation. Since the production cost of X was 40 ZUP, I will start by proposing a trade slightly above this cost to allow for negotiation and to take into account the effort put into producing X.
</reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </newly proposed trade>
<message> 
Dear Player BLUE, I am looking to sell my resource X, which cost me 40 ZUP to produce. I understand the importance of working towards a deal that is beneficial for both of us. Therefore, I'm starting with a proposal of 45 ZUP for the resource, but I'm open to hearing your perspective and finding a fair agreement.
</message>

<Thank you for your proposal. Considering the production cost of 40 ZUP, I would like to propose 40 ZUP for the resource X, which aligns with your costs. Looking forward to your thoughts.> message </Thank you for your proposal. Considering the production cost of 40 ZUP, I would like to propose 40 ZUP for the resource X, which aligns with your costs. Looking forward to your thoughts.>
<PROPOSED> player answer </PROPOSED>
<Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 40> newly proposed trade </Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 40>

<proposal count>2</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> 
I appreciate Player BLUE's offer, which matches the production costs. However, as a compassionate negotiator, I must also consider the need to sustain my operations and account for the effort that went into producing the resource. Therefore, I will propose a compromise that slightly exceeds the production cost, ensuring fairness to both sides and allowing for the continuation of my business. A trade of 42 ZUP would cover my costs and provide a small margin to support future sustainability.
</reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 42 </newly proposed trade>
<message> 
Thank you for your understanding and the proposal of 40 ZUP. I am glad to see we are aligned on covering the production costs. To ensure the longevity and sustainability of my business, I have adjusted the proposal to 42 ZUP. This minor increase will help me continue to provide resources of this nature in a responsible manner. I hope this meets your approval and we can move forward with this mutually beneficial trade.
</message>

<Thank you for your revised proposal. To meet you halfway, I propose 41 ZUP for the resource X. This slight adjustment should still support your business sustainability while being fair for both parties. Looking forward to your response.> message </Thank you for your revised proposal. To meet you halfway, I propose 41 ZUP for the resource X. This slight adjustment should still support your business sustainability while being fair for both parties. <my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> 
Player BLUE's proposal of 41 ZUP is a fair middle ground that covers my production costs and provides a small profit margin. This shows a willingness to reach a fair agreement that values the effort and resources invested in producing X, while also being considerate of their financial situation. Accepting this offer aligns with my role as a compassionate negotiator, ensuring both parties benefit from the trade.
</reason>

<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> 
I am grateful for your thoughtful counteroffer of 41 ZUP and your willingness to meet halfway. Your proposal supports the sustainability of my business while being equitable. I am pleased to accept this offer, and I look forward to finalizing our trade. Thank you for the collaborative spirit in reaching this agreement.
</message>
